text: Legislative elections were held in the German Democratic Republic on 8 June 1986. 500 deputies to the Volkskammer were elected, with all of them being candidates of the single-list National Front. 703 Front candidates were put forward, with 500 being elected and 203 becoming substitute deputies. At its first session on 16 June, the Volkskammer re-elected Willi Stoph as Chairman of the Council of Ministers, while Erich Honecker, General Secretary of the ruling Socialist Unity Party, was also re-elected Chairman of the Council of State. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Alliance !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/- |- |rowspan=10 align=left|National Front||align=left|Socialist Unity Party of Germany||rowspan=10|12,392,094||rowspan=10|99.94||127||0 |- |align=left|Free German Trade Union Federation||61||–7 |- |align=left|Christian Democratic Union||52||0 |- |align=left|Liberal Democratic Party of Germany||52||0 |- |align=left|National Democratic Party of Germany||52||0 |- |align=left|Democratic Farmers' Party of Germany||52||0 |- |align=left|Free German Youth||37||–3 |- |align=left|Democratic Women's League of Germany||32||–3 |- |align=left|Cultural Association of the GDR||21||–1 |- |align=left|Peasants Mutual Aid Association||14||New |- |colspan=2 align=left|Against||7,512||0.06||–||– |- |colspan=2 align=left|Invalid/blank votes||2,407||–||–||– |- |colspan=2 align=left|Total||12,402,013||100||500||0 |- |colspan=2 align=left|Registered voters/turnout||12,434,444||99.74||–||– |- |colspan=6 align=left|Source: IPU (votes) |} ==See also== * List of Volkskammer members (9th election period) ==References== ;General * Peter W.
